alert.note: Alert for Imperial (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 08 at 9:10PM PDT until August 09 at 12:30AM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM PDT TUESDAY FOR SOUTHEASTERN IMPERIAL COUNTY... At 910 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash highways and normally dry washes. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Olgilby Road. Otherwise, mainly rural areas of Southeastern Imperial County. This includes the following streams and drainages... Araz Wash and Picacho Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. It especially dangerous at night because it is harder to see submerged roadways and determine how deep the water is.
